EmailTemplate.name: Jorge Arce Web Dev 201
EmailTemplate.subject: Design Your Website for the Global Marketplace
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
U.S. Commercial Service Logo
Export University 201:
Website Design for a Global Marketplace
According to Forrester Research, 50% of Internet traffic in the United States originates overseas as of 2010. Can you afford to ignore 50% or more of your “walk-in” traffic?
This is a NON-TECHNICAL seminar for management and staff to learn about the low-cost to no-cost modifications to internationalize your website.
[1]
Date: Wednesday, October 7, 2015
Agenda:
Registration, Coffee, and Networking: 8:00 – 8:15 AM
Presentation: 8:15 – 10:45 AM
Website Globalization
​ - Phased Approach
- Simple Enhancements (do’s and don’ts)
- Internationalization
- Localization
Translating Your Website
Proactive Promotion (Search Engine Optimization)
Q&A: 10:45 – 11:00 AM
Location: Gainesville Area Chamber of Commerce
300 E. University Ave., Suite 100
Gainesville, FL 32601
Cost: $25.00 (Coffee, pastries included, free parking)
The U.S. Commercial Service is part of the U.S. Department of Commerce that promotes “Made in USA” products and services abroad. The information provided is offered by the U.S. Commercial Service’s Task Force on Website Optimization to businesses to assist them in maximizing their sales potential overseas.
References
1. http://business.gainesvillechamber.com/events/details/export-university-201-website-design-for-a-global-marketplace-2237
